Posts.Content: I agree, GP first. We do still get ailments like everyone else but check it out. I got breathless and my doctor said if it’s a tumour big enough to make you breathless it will show up on an X-ray, agree? He sent me for one, nothing there so I was satisfied. He was very clever and understanding about my worry. Some aren’t but I’m lucky. The worry never really leaves but just accept it is natural and be sensible once it’s been checked out. Put it to one side then. Good luck and let us know. Xx
Posts.Title: phlegmy cough sometimes dry and tickly - am I mad ?!?

Posts.Content: Hi Eddiboy. Thanks so much for your reply. I’ve decided to go back in a couple of weeks to see him again. He is a junior at the practice so had to get advice from the senior partner who happens to be my usual GP. I’m so  surprised at her answer to tell you the truth. It’s like I don’t matter anymore and I take a back seat because of all the newly diagnosed cases. I sometimes think ‘at least I’m here and should be grateful for that’ but this is really bothering me. It is a reminder every day! I actually work in the hospital and have access to the BCN whenever I need. I asked them last year to examine me as I was a bit worried, when the GP found out she wasn’t very pleased I felt. I say if someone hasn’t had cancer they shouldn’t judge and if they have, they should understand, especially in there position as GPs I’ll let you know when I’ve been again. I’m sorry about the recurrence. We can pray you’ll have the success now as you did 17 years ago. Do let me know please.  Xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer implant problem

Posts.Content: I had a breast implant in 2003 after a mastectomy in 1997. It’s migrated so I feel it’s under my chin! I use a gel prosthesis in my bra. I’ve become really conscious about it. GP says she won’t refer me because it’s cosmetic. What do you think? Thanks.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer implant problem
